snippet: During World War II, the Reilly brothers, who grew up in Queens, were part of a unit that stormed the small Japanese-held island called Tarawa Atoll. It would be their last hour together.
abstract: Remains of James P Reilly, lost in battlefield grave for decades, are reburied in Florida cemetery near grave of his twin brother Michael J; brothers were in combat together in World War II when James was killed by Japanese gunfire; Michael died in 2005.

byline.original: By KIRK SEMPLE and LANCE SPEERE
byline.contributor: Kirk Semple reported from New York, and Lance Speere from Florida.

lead_paragraph: During World War II, the Reilly brothers, who grew up in Queens, were part of a unit that stormed the small Japanese-held island called Tarawa Atoll. It would be their last hour together.

headline.main: Torn Asunder in 1943 Battle, Twins Are Reunited Under Florida Soil
headline.print_headline: Torn Asunder in Wartime, Twins Unite in Interment
